description: Overview for single node VictoriaMetrics v1.40.0 or higher

panels.description: CPU Usage by VictoriaMetrics Process Only

targets.expr: (sum(rate(process_cpu_seconds_total{job="$job", instance="$instance"}[$interval])) by () or sum(irate(process_cpu_seconds_total{job="$job", instance="$instance"}[5m])) by ()) / count(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="user", node_name="pmm-server"})*100

panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: Memory Allocated and In use by VictoriaMetrics Process Only
panels.title: Memory Usage

panels.description: Shows percent of occupied disk space by data points on the remaining disk space at `-storageDataPath`
panels.title: Disk Usage

panels.description: How many datapoints are in storage
panels.title: Total Datapoints

panels.description: How many entries inverted index contains. This value is proportional to the number of unique timeseries in storage(cardinality).
panels.title: Index Size

panels.description:
Shows how many ongoing insertions are taking place.
* `max` - equal to number of CPU * 2
* `current` - current number of goroutines busy with inserting rows into storage

When `current` hits `max` constantly, it means storage is overloaded and require more CPU.
panels.title: Concurrent Inserts

panels.description: VictoriaMetrics stores various caches in RAM. Memory size for these caches may be limited with -`memory.allowedPercent` flag. Line `max allowed` shows max allowed memory size for cache.
panels.title: Cache Memory Usage

panels.description: Estimated time of Disk usage based on trend
panels.title: Time before run out of space

panels.description:
* `*` - unsupported query path
* `/write` - insert into VM
* `/metrics` - query VM system metrics
* `/query` - query instant values
* `/query_range` - query over a range of time
* `/series` - match a certain label set
* `/label/{}/values` - query a list of label values (variables mostly)

targets.expr: sum(rate(vm_http_requests_total{job="$job", instance=~"$instance", path!~"/favicon.ico"}[$interval]) or irate(vm_http_requests_total{job="$job", instance=~"$instance", path!~"/favicon.ico"}[5m])) by (path)

panels.title: Requests

panels.description:
Shows increase/decrease of active time series with new data points inserted during the last hour. High value may result in ingestion slowdown. 

See following link for details:

targets.expr: increase(vm_cache_entries{job="$job", instance=~"$instance", type="storage/hour_metric_ids"}[$interval]) or increase(vm_cache_entries{job="$job", instance=~"$instance", type="storage/hour_metric_ids"}[5m])

panels.title: Active Time Series Changes

panels.description:
The less time it takes is better.
* `*` - unsupported query path
* `/write` - insert into VM
* `/metrics` - query VM system metrics
* `/query` - query instant values
* `/query_range` - query over a range of time
* `/series` - match a certain label set
* `/label/{}/values` - query a list of label values (variables mostly)
panels.title: Queries Duration

panels.description:
The less time it takes is better.
* `*` - unsupported query path
* `/write` - insert into VM
* `/metrics` - query VM system metrics
* `/query` - query instant values
* `/query_range` - query over a range of time
* `/series` - match a certain label set
* `/label/{}/values` - query a list of label values (variables mostly)
panels.title: Queries Duration Details

panels.description: VictoriaMetrics stores various caches in RAM. Memory size for these caches may be limited with -`memory.allowedPercent` flag. Line `max allowed` shows max allowed memory size for cache.
panels.title: Cache Memory Usage

panels.description: VictoriaMetrics stores various caches in RAM. Memory size for these caches may be limited with -`memory.allowedPercent` flag. Line `max allowed` shows max allowed memory size for cache.
panels.title: Cache Size

panels.description:
Shows how many ongoing insertions are taking place.
* `max` - equal to number of CPU * 2
* `current` - current number of goroutines busy with inserting rows into storage

When `current` hits `max` constantly, it means storage is overloaded and require more CPU.
panels.title: Concurrent Inserts

panels.description:
* `*` - unsupported query path
* `/write` - insert into VM
* `/metrics` - query VM system metrics
* `/query` - query instant values
* `/query_range` - query over a range of time
* `/series` - match a certain label set
* `/label/{}/values` - query a list of label values (variables mostly)
panels.title: Error Requests

panels.description: Shows amount of on-disk space occupied by data points and the remaining disk space at `-storageDataPath`
panels.title: Disk Space Usage - Datapoints

panels.description: Shows amount of on-disk space occupied by inverted index.
panels.title: Disk Space Usage - Index

panels.description: How many datapoints are inserted into storage per second
panels.title: Datapoints Ingestions

panels.description: How many datapoints are in RAM queue waiting to be written into storage. The number of pending data points should be in the range from 0 to `2*<ingestion_rate>`, since VictoriaMetrics pushes pending data to persistent storage every second.
panels.title: Pending Datapoints

panels.description: Shows how many datapoints are in the storage and what is average disk usage per datapoint.

targets.expr: sum(vm_data_size_bytes{job="$job", instance=~"$instance", type!="indexdb"}) / sum(vm_rows{job="$job", instance=~"$instance", type != "indexdb"})

panels.title: Datapoints

panels.description:
Data parts of LSM tree.
High number of parts could be an evidence of slow merge performance - check the resource utilization.
* `indexdb` - inverted index
* `storage/small` - recently added parts of data ingested into storage(hot data)
* `storage/big` -  small parts gradually merged into big parts (cold data)
panels.title: LSM Parts

panels.description: The number of on-going merges in storage nodes.  It is expected to have high numbers for `storage/small` metric.
panels.title: Active Merges

panels.description: The number of rows merged per second by storage nodes.
panels.title: Merge speed

panels.description: Shows how many rows were ignored on insertion due to corrupted or out of retention timestamps.
panels.title: Ignored Rows

panels.description: Shows the rate of logging the messages by their level. Unexpected spike in rate is a good reason to check logs.
panels.title: Logging Messages

panels.description:
Shows how many of new time-series are created every second.  High churn rate tightly connected with database performance and may result in unexpected OOM's or slow queries. It is recommended to always keep an eye on this metric to avoid unexpected cardinality "explosions".

Good references to read:
* https://www.robustperception.io/cardinality-is-key
* https://www.robustperception.io/using-tsdb-analyze-to-investigate-churn-and-cardinality
panels.title: Churn Rate

panels.description: Slow queries rate according to `search.logSlowQueryDuration` flag, which is `5s` by default.
panels.title: Slow Queries

panels.description:
The percentage of slow inserts comparing to total insertion rate.

The less value is better. If percentage remains high (>50%) during extended periods of time, then it is likely more RAM is needed for optimal handling of the current number of active time series. 

In general, VictoriaMetrics requires ~1KB or RAM per active time series, so it should be easy calculating the required amounts of RAM for the current workload according to capacity planning docs. But the resulting number may be far from the real number because the required amounts of memory depends on may other factors such as the number of labels per time series and the length of label values.
panels.title: Slow Inserts

panels.description: Shows the number of active time series. High value may result in ingestion slowdown.
panels.title: Time Series
Top 10 metrics by time series count

targets.expr:
topk(10, sum by (node_name) (count({__name__=~".+",instance!="pmm-server"})  by (node_name) or 
label_replace(
label_join(count({__name__=~".+",instance="pmm-server"})  by (instance,node_name), "node_name", ",","instance"),
"node_name", "pmm-server", "node_name", "pmm-server")
))

panels.title: Top 10 hosts by time series count

panels.description: Run VM with `-help` flag to see all the available flags with description and default values
panels.title: Flags

targets.expr: avg by (node_name) ((sum(rate(node_network_receive_bytes_total{node_name="pmm-server", device!="lo"}[$interval]) or irate(node_network_receive_bytes_total{node_name="pmm-server", device!="lo"}[5m]))) + (sum(rate(node_network_transmit_bytes_total{node_name="pmm-server", device!="lo"}[$interval]) or irate(node_network_transmit_bytes_total{node_name="pmm-server", device!="lo"}[5m]))))

options.content: Please go to PMM Settings page to get Diagnostic data

title: VictoriaMetrics
